questions.question_text: Which three functions are supported by Workspace ONE Intelligence? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Set event driven automated API actions.
choices.A: Conduct augmented analysis with artificial intelligence.
choices.B: Perform integration with other service platforms.
choices.E: Automate suggested actions based on VMware recommended practices.

discussion.content:
it could be D, here:
https://techzone.vmware.com/getting-started-workspace-one-intelligence-reports-and-dashboards-workspace-one-operational#_1017742
you can see:
"Among the multiple available Connectors, the Workspace ONE UEM connector is key, as it enables Intelligence Automation to take actions against your organization's devices, apps, and os updates."

choices.C: Deliver "˜System Updates' profile that defers updates up to 30 days.
choices.B: Deliver "˜System Updates' profile with change freeze payload.
choices.A: Deliver "˜Restrictions' profile that disables Play Store on devices.
choices.D: Deliver "˜Restrictions' profile that disables chrome on devices.

questions.question_text:
An administrator must ensure enrolled corporate owned Android Enterprise devices do not update during the holiday season.
Which is VMware's recommended best practice to accomplish this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Under System Updates > Automatic Updates > 
Annual System Update Freeze Periods (Android 9.0 and higher Work Managed and COPE devices) Device owners can postpone OTA system updates to devices for up to 90 days to freeze the OS version running on these devices over critical periods (such as holidays). The system enforces a mandatory 60-day buffer after any defined freeze period to prevent freezing the device indefinitely.
During a freeze period:
Devices do not receive any notifications about pending OTA updates.
Devices do not install any OTA updates to the OS.
Device users are not able to manually check for OTA updates.
Freeze Period Use this field to set freeze periods, in month and day, when updates cannot be installed. When the time of the device is within any of the freeze periods, all incoming system updates, including security patches, are blocked and cannot be installed. Each individual freeze period is allowed to be at most 90 days long and adjacent freeze periods need to be at least 60 days a part.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is configuring the on-premises auxiliary components for a first time implementation. During initial testing the administrator notices an error and is unable to browse the environment from a work issued PC located on the internal network. While accessing other internet sites, the administrator has no issues browsing or accessing publicly available sites. After talking with the IT department, the administrator confirmed there have been no new firewall rules added.
Which could be a reason the administrator is having issues accessing the newly created SaaS environment?

choices.B: The administrator is utilizing IPv6 addressing and needs to revert to IPv4 addressing.
choices.A: The Windows 10 profile has not been pushed to the device to allow access to the environment.
choices.C: The VMware IP space has not been whitelisted for access in the administrator's firewall rules.
choices.D: The Workspace ONE environment needs to be upgraded to a compatible version with the customers firewall.

comments.content: This question is nebulous at best, but if you tear it apart, it sure seems like the reference you provide does everything but mention the Assist function. Has to be C.

discussion.content: The Answer should be C as per https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2008/WS1_Assist/GUID-03ABDF9E-6709-4282-A24E-D348AA7D8076.html

key word "on-premises" IPv4 is the required protocol for the Workspace ONE Assist server. You must disable IPv6.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2008/WS1_Assist/GUID-C548EAF6-768E-4D48-88A2-1432CFEA8A73.html

comments.content: That would be the case for an installation but here we're talking about "environment access from a work issued PC" and for that we don't need ipv6. Therefore "C" makes more sense.
I agree. The others are found in the SAAS environment.

That would be it but the question does not allow for two answers (or maybe its a typo?)
I'm clueless since both are possible customer maintained components.

discussion.content: I would say A only, even though the ACC is internal infrastructure it does not use a local Load balancer, it load balances on the UEM. The UAG, on the other-hand would require local load balancers.
the keyword is "customer's security team" answer is A.

comments.content: WS1 components are console, device service and database , answer should be BDE. But HA Database is critical
when ws1 deployed on the cloud ws1 db is on the cloud, so not E
revision..i though the question is cloud deployment but only mention as SaaS not mention about cloud deployment, but i still prefer to choose UAG or airwatch cloud connector

questions.question_text:
A customer has decided to use VMware Workspace ONE as their primary SaaS solution for endpoint management. The customer's security team requires all infrastructure to support High Availability (HA).
Which components of Workspace ONE will need to be maintained by the customer?
Which Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) configuration item is a pre-requisite to creating a third party identity provider in Workspace ONE Access?

comments.content: Agreed. SAML assertion is just the reply the IdP sends to the SP.

discussion.content:
Correct: D 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/20.01/ws1_access_authentication/GUID-0C459D5A-A0FF-4893-87A0-10ADDC4E1B8D.html - here one of the prerequisites is: Obtain the appropriate third-party metadata information to add when you configure the identity provider in the Workspace ONE Access console. The metadata information you obtain from the third-party instance is either the URL to the metadata or the actual metadata.
